description: Minor material amendment (S.73) to vary condition no.2 (Approved Plans), no. 3 (materials and brick detail) and no. 4 (green roof), seeking to allow changes on the design including creation of an external staircase and landing, creation of a recess with louvres and to retain existing brickwork above ground floor windows in pursuant to planning permission reference 200618FUL dated 14/05/2020  for' First floor rear extension and partial retention of existing temporary hardstanding.'
decision_conditions: The development permitted shall be begun before the expiration of three years from the date of the original permission (200618FUL), which was 14/05/2020. The new date for the expiration of this planning permission would therefore be 14/05/2023.

Reason: To comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended). | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Arboricultural Method Statement-Rev-1, Project No.: NBMR101/001, prepared by Thomspon Ecology, dated 30.11.2018; Design & Access Statement+Planning Statement-Rev-A, ref 2692, prepared by NBF Partnership, dated February 2020; Flood Risk Assessment Technical Note-Version-2.0, prepared by Plowman Cravan, dated July 2018; Flood Risk Assessment, Project Number:A5869, prepared by CTP Consulting Engineers, dated 03.12.2018; Environmental Noise Survey, Report 25570/ENS1, prepared by Hann Tucker Associates, dated 18.06.2018; Preliminary Bat Roost Assessment-Rev-A, Report No: RT-MME-128067-02, prepared by Middlemarch-Environmental, dated  20.07.2018; Nocturnal Emergence and Dawn Re-entry Bat Surveys, Report No: RT-MME-128487, prepared by Middlemarch-Environmental, dated 28.08.2018; 18339-DID-ZZ-00-DR-C-5001-Rev-P01; Drainage Assessment Form, prepared by CTP Consulting Engineers, dated 30.11.2018; Preliminary Ecological Appraisal-Rev-A, Report No: RT-MME-128067-01, prepared by Middlemarch-Environmental, dated 20.07.2018; 01-Rev-A; 02-Rev-A; 03-Rev-C ; 05-Rev-A; 06-Rev-A; 07-Rev-C3; 08-Rev-C3; 09-Rev-C3; 10-Rev-A; 11-Rev-A; 12-Rev-A; 13-Rev-A; 14-Rev-C2; 15-Rev-C2; 16-Rev-C2; 17-Rev-C2; 18-Rev C2

Reason: For the avoidance of doubt and in the interests of proper planning. | The bricks, mortar and pointing of the proposed extension hereby approved shall match the existing building in terms of colour, texture, appearance and architectural detailing. The approved brickwork detailing on the development hereby approved, shall be constructed in accordance with drawing ref: 14-Rev-C2; 15-Rev-C2; 16-Rev-C2; 17-Rev-C2 and permanently be retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings and to secure high-quality architectural detailing in accordance with Policies 7.4 and 7.6 of The London Plan and Policies 7.4 and 7B of the Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The 187.3 sq. m. of extensive green roof shall be laid out in accordance with the details shown on the approved roof plan (ref: 09-Rev-C3) in the nearest planting season following construction (1st October to 28th February inclusive). The detailed design of the extensive roof shall incorporate the following:
- Be biodiversity based, with extensive substrate base varying in depth from 80mm to 150mm;
- Growing medium should not be more than 20% organic matter by volume;

- Be planted/seeded with a mix of native species within the first planting season following the practical completion. The seed mix shall be focused on wildflower planting and shall contain no more than 25% sedum;
- Have relevant efficient and effective drainage and irrigation to sustain the vegetation.
(d) Prior to the first use of the development hereby approved a five-year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.
The approved green roof shall be retained as such thereafter and the approved maintenance plan adhered to.

Reason:  To ensure the development provides the maximum possible provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of The London Plan, Draft London Plan Policy G5, Greater London Authority, Living Roofs and Walls, Technical Report: Supporting London Plan Policy and 1.2 of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy and Policies 5.10 and 5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | (a) At least 1,144 sq. m. of native wildflower planting shall be planted in accordance with plan ref: 03-Rev-C in the nearest planting season (1st October to 28th February inclusive) following the expiration of temporary planning application reference 185766FUL.
(b) Prior to the first use of the development hereby approved, a five-year post planting maintenance and inspection schedule shall be submitted to and approved by the Local Planning Authority.
The approved planting shall be retained as such thereafter and the approved maintenance plan adhered to.

Reason:  To mitigate the retention of hardstanding and ensure the development provides the maximum reasonable provision towards the creation of habitats and valuable areas for biodiversity in accordance with Policies 5.3, 5.10, 5.11, 5.12 and 7.19 of The London Plan, Draft London Plan Policy G5, Greater London Authority, Living Roofs and Walls, Technical Report: Supporting London Plan Policy and 1.2 of Ealing's Development (or Core) Strategy and Policies 5.10 and 5.11 of Ealing's Development Management DPD. | The tree protection measures detailed in the Arboricultural Impact Assessment and Arboricultural Method Statement-Rev-01, Project No.: NBMR101/001, prepared by Thomson Ecology, dated 30.11.2018 shall be installed prior to the commencement of development (including ground works and site clearance). All tree protection methods detailed in the approved Arboricultural Method Statement shall not be moved or removed, temporarily or otherwise, until all works including external works have been completed and all equipment, machinery and surplus materials have been removed from the site.

Reason: To contribute to the quality and character of London's environment, air quality and adapting to and mitigating climate change in accordance with Policies 5.10 and 7.21 of The London Plan, Policy 5.10 of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 9 - Trees and Development Guidelines. | Prior to first use of the development hereby approved, anti-vibration measures shall be installed to ensure that any associated machinery, plant/equipment, extract/ventilation systems and ducting are mounted with proprietary anti-vibration isolators and fan motors are vibration isolated from the casing and adequately silenced.   The anti-vibration measures shall permanently be retained thereafter.

Reason: To safeguard residential amenity in accordance with Policy 7.15 of The London Plan, Policy 1.1 of Ealing's Development (Core) Strategy, Policy 7A of Ealing's Development Management DPD and Ealing's SPG 10 - 'Noise and Vibration'. | Prior to the first use of the building hereby permitted, details of the ventilation scheme shall be submitted to and approval by the Local Planning Authority. The approved details shall be implemented prior to the first use and permanently retained as such thereafter.

Reason: To ensure appropriate air quality of classrooms and mitigate potential harm from the proximity with to North Circular Road in accordance with 7.14 of the London Plan and Policy SI1 of the Draft London Plan.
site_name: William Perkin C Of E High School
